= Details =

==PostgreSQL==

Download PostgreSQL: http://www.enterprisedb.com/products/pgdownload.do#windows

 * Accept all defaults
 * Locate pgAdmin within the start menu (found under the PostgreSQL folder)
 * Right-click "localhost", enable "Save password"
 * Add the Postgres bin directory to your path

==TomCat==

Download TomCat 5.5.x as a standalone zip: http://tomcat.apache.org/download-55.cgi
  
  * unzip archive to a chosen directory
  * Right-click "MyComputer"->Select "Advanced System Settings"->Select "Advanced"->Select "Environment Variables"->New
  * Set the "Variable name" to "TOMCAT_DIR"
  * Set the "Variable value" to the directory that you unzipped the archive into

==Perl==
  
Download Strawberry Perl: http://strawberryperl.com/

 * Select the latest 5.x series available
 * Open a terminal/powershell
 * cpan DBD::PgPP

==Ant==

Download Apache ant: http://ant.apache.org/bindownload.cgi

 * Download the zip archive
 * Extract to a chosen directory
 * Right-click "MyComputer"->Select "Advanced System Settings"->Select "Advanced"->Select "Environment Variables"->New
 * Set the "Variable name" to "ANT_HOME"
 * Set the "Variable value" to the directory that you unzipped the archive into

 * Append the location of the ANT bin directory to the PATH ENV

==Download a Subversion client==

Recommended client: http://tortoisesvn.tigris.org/

==Java SDK==

Download the latest JDK 6.x release: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html

 * Add the location of the bin directory to the PATH
 * Add the JAVA_HOME ENV and set it to the directory Java is installed into

==wget==

Download the win32 wget: http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/wget.htm

 * Add the bin directory of wget to your PATH env
